text: 1.) What cognitive skills are strengthened by our use of computers and the Internet, according to the passage?

options.text: Visual-spatial skills, hand-eye coordination, and reflex response.
Critical thinking, imagination, and reflective analysis.

text: 2.) What did the study of video gaming reveal about the impact of action games on cognitive skills?

options.text: Action games enhance deep processing and mindful knowledge acquisition.
Action games improve reading skills and language comprehension.
Action games increase the speed of shifting visual focus and processing visual cues.
Action games boost memory retention and information recall.

text: 3.) What conclusion did Patricia Greenfield draw from her review of studies on the effects of media on intelligence and learning ability?

options.text: Media consumption enhances all cognitive skills equally.
Every medium develops specific cognitive skills at the expense of others.
Media usage has no significant impact on cognitive skills.
Cognitive skills are only affected by traditional learning methods, not media.

text: 4.) What is the main concern regarding the impact of online habits on cognitive skills, as discussed in the passage?

options.text: Online habits strengthen neural circuits for deep processing and critical thinking.
Online habits lead to the weakening of visual-spatial skills and hand-eye coordination.
Online habits reinforce skimming and multitasking while neglecting deep reading and
Online habits have a temporary impact on cognitive skills without long-term consequences.
